
### dup2 exercise  {.smaller}



* recall: <code>dup2(old_fd, new_fd)</code>
 
```
int fd = open("output.txt", O_WRONLY | O_CREAT, 0666);
write(STDOUT_FILENO, "A", 1);
dup2(fd, STDOUT_FILENO);
pid_t pid = fork();
if (pid == 0) { /* child: */
    dup2(STDOUT_FILENO, fd); write(fd, "B", 1);
} else {
    write(STDOUT_FILENO, "C", 1);
}

```
 Which outputs are possible?<br>[]{.my-small} <table>
<tr><td>A. stdout: ABC ; output.txt: empty</td><td>D. stdout: A ; output.txt: BC</td></tr>
<tr><td>B. stdout: AC ; output.txt: B</td><td>E. more?</td></tr>
<tr><td>C. stdout: A ; output.txt: CB</td></tr>
</table>
